column1: 1505|three-oh-five|Five minutes ago it was three o'clock
column3:
but I theorize that it must now be about three-oh-five."
I folded my arms. "I don't usually do stakeouts."

column1: 1505|3:05 P.M.|For one moment Ruth could see the bones of the bats standing out clearly
column2:
as if in an X-ray picture.
Then all the green turned black.
It was 3:05 P.M.
at five minutes past three that afternoon
column3:
Smith admitted the falsity of the Fort Scott tale.
"That was only something Dick told his family. So he could stay out overnight. Do some drinking."
